page.title: 05Ecology.
page.content: The temperate climate enables Scilly to have its' great variety of flora and fauna, much of which cannot be found elsewhere in the U.K..There is also very little pollution here. The scenery is beautiful both in summer when it appears a tropical paradise and in winter when fierce gales and storms have a dramatic appeal.There is a footpath around the whole coastline and this area is very popular with walkers.This area attracts many ornithologists who like to see the great variety of seabirds and the migrants and other rare species that frequent these islands in the spring and autumn.Seals are also to be seen and the area is also a great attraction to divers who enjoy the clear water and interesting marine life and shipwrecks.
